page.title: 18Bradford Abbas Church part 1
page.content: {Religion and local history.}The The earliest known references to a church in Bradford Abbas appear in a Papal Bull of 1163 when Pope Alexander III confirmed to clement. Including Mr. Greene there have been 45 vicars. Three have died before retiring. The church has a choir and a Sunday School. There are 5 people in the choir and 13 in the Sunday School. Sometimes, in the Family Service, the choir hold up pictures. The Family Service is every 3 weeks. Opposite the church is the Vicarage but Mr. Greene does not live there. As he is vicar of Thornford as well, he lives there. There are 31 pews in church and at the back of the church there is an organ. The church has a bell tower.
